page.title: 18TOWER AT MILLBRAE
page.content:
A few hundred yards to the east of the large farm of Scar there lies, upon a small rise,a building known as the {Tower}which in appearance resembles a {Pictish Broch.
When it is investigated it is found to be only{100_150}years old. It is{3.91 {metres}high,{1.57 metres}in diameter and it has a circumference of{4.93 {metres.
In the days of the{Orkney kelp industry a{flag}was fixed atop the Tower.If it was fully raised the flag would signal that a kelp boat was in.If it was at half mast it would mean that a coal boat was in port. There is a splendid view from the top of the Tower which is the{highest {point}in Burness.
